_exec_summary.SummaryText: Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response Policies:Cargill Meat Solution's chemical accident prevention and emergency response policies for ammonia refrigeration involve the development of thes Risk Management Program and Plan (RMP) which has a primary objective of preventing an accidental release of ammonia, and minimizing the consequences of a relase should one occur.  Senior mangement has appointed a PSM Coordinator to monitor and maintain overall compliance with both OSHA's PSM and EPA's RMP regulations.  Facility and Reguated Substances: The stationary source subject to this RMP is Cargill's further processing facility located in Albert Lea, MN.  The regulated substance that is the subject of this RMP is anhydrous ammonia used in the refrigeration system.  General Accidental Release Prevention Program and Chemical Spcific Prevention Steps: In accordance with RMP regulations, the general accidental release prevention program for this facility's ammonia refrigeration system is comprised of the following components: process safety information, process hazard analysis, operation procedures, operator training, procedures for maintaining mechanical intergrity, procedures for managing system changes, pre-start up safety review procedures, procedures for investigating release incidents, and hot work permit protocols.  This program was developed with the participation of the affected employees, and will be periodically audited for compliance as required by the RMP regulations.  In addition, the facility has in place procedures for notifying contractors and their employees of the hazards of the system.  Chemical specific prevention steps are included within the program, including engineering and administrative control designed to prevent and minimize accidental releases.  Five Year History:  In the previous five years, this facility has not had any acidental releases of ammonia which have resuted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on site, or

known off site deaths, injuries evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage, or environmental damage.  Emergency Response Program:  This facility has developed an Emergency Action Plan (EAP) which addresses accidental releases of hazardous substances and has coordinated with the Albert Lea Joint Local Emercency Planning Commission (LEPC).  The facility is included in the LEPC's community emergency response plan.  The facility is currently deemed a non responding facility under the RMP regulations and the facility's RMP, which means responders have primary responsibility for responding to accidental releases of ammonia which pose a health or safety hazard to persons or property located on site or off site.  Planned Canges to Improve Safety:  The most recent process hazard analysis was performed 7-19-2006.  The last MOC was conducted on 2/1/2009.  The facility continues to monitor and maintain its PSM/RMP program through an organized PSM team chargered to ensure all elements of the PSM/RMP program are in place.  Worst-Case Senerio for RMP 2009:  The largest vessel which is located outdoors and has a maximum capacity of 3,000 lbs the worst case senario assumes that this entire amount would release in 10 minutes, as a result of a catastrophic failure of the tank.  The worst-case senario would reach public offsite endpoints.  Results of Consequence Analysis: Chemical: Anydrous Ammonia.  CAS #: 7664-41-7.  Physical State: toxic gas liquified by refrigeration.  Senario:  Worst-case.  Quatity released: 3,000 pounds.  Release Duration: 10 minues.  Release rate: 300 pounds per minute.  Mitigation Measures:  NONE.  Topography:  Urban.  Toxic Endpoint: 0.3 mg/L.  Wind Speed 1.5 meters/second (3.4 miles/hour)  Stability Class: F.  Air Temperature: 77 degrees F (25 degrees C).  Alternate Release Senario for RMP 2009:  The alternate release scenario consits of a pipe leak, which discharges 360 pounds of ammonia in 10 minutes prior to the operator stopping the leak.  This sce

nario may reach offsite endpoints and would effect public receptors.  Reults of Cnesequence Analysis:  Chemical: anhydrous ammonia.   CAS # 7664-41-7.  Category: Toxic gas liquified by refrigeration.  Scenario: alternative.  Release duration: 10 minutes.  Release Rate: 4 pounds per minute.  Mitigation measures: none.  Topography: Urban.  Toxic Endpoint: .1 mg/L.  Wind Speed: 3 meters/second (6.7 miles/hour)  Stability Class: D.  Air Temperature: 77 degrees F (25 degrees C).
